newsitem.title: BRAZIL: RESEARCH ALERT-Casa Anglo upped to hold.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT-Casa Anglo upped to hold.

text.p: Fator Securities said it had upgraded Brazilian retailer Casa Anglo, the holding company for department store chain Mappin, to hold from sell.
- also said the stock could be a good buy option below 45 reais per 1,000 shares.
- said it believes Mappin is going through a moment of transition, improving management of its inventories.

- "However, some doubts still exist regarding Casa Anglo's strategy in terms of franchises and the new companies which are being set up," it said in a report. It is a moment of change and investors should pay attention, it added.
- Casa Anglo is controlled by United Industria e Comercio, owned by businessman Ricardo Mansur. Last month, United agreed to buy local retailer Mesbla.
- Casa Anglo preferred was up 2.0 percent at 51 reais at 1640 local/1940 GMT on the Sao Paulo bolsa.
